posts.message: Our poster "WikiNotes: Unifying Preclinical Education" recently won the Innovations Award at the 2015 Spring Conference "Collaborating to Train Tomorrow’s Physicians" hosted by the Association of American Medical Colleges (AAMC) Central Group on Educational Affairs (CGEA), Central Group on Student Affairs (CGSA), and Central Organization of Student Representatives (COSR)!

WikiNotes has some useful resources for the Year 1 Neuroscience course. Check out the Laboratory Atlas Quizzes and other pages!

As always, if you see something in need of updating, feel free to click the Edit button and make those changes! Get started at the link below by logging in with your School of Medicine login ID.
Proud to say that Draw It Know It is back with new videos!

We could use some help adding clerkship experiences to WikiNotes! If you have a general overview or comments on a rotation you'd like to share, add it to our Clinical Campus Guide!

If you've never added anything to WikiNotes before, you can check out our Sandbox page for tips on formatting. You can also click Edit at the top of other pages to get an idea of how others have formatted their pages.

Get started at the link below by logging in with your School of Medicine login ID!

We could use some help adding course pack notes to WikiNotes! If you see something that needs to be corrected, just click the Edit tab in the top right to start making changes. If you want to create a new page, take a peek at the formatting on an existing page or refer to the Sandbox page to see how it's done.

Get started at the link below by logging in with your School of Medicine login ID!

Come learn about Open Source Medicine, the student organization that's brought you WSUSOM's Streaming Media website, My Health Report, WikiNotes, and more! Join us at our first mass meeting of the 2014-2015 school year for free food and see how you can get involved, even if you’re not a “techie!”

Meeting details:
Date: Thursday, 9/4/2014
Time: 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM
Location: Mazurek Medical Education Commons, Rooms 242-243
RSVP: RSVP at the link below so we know how much food to order!
Support OSM! Buy your shirt! :) Shirts are $15 and available at Scott Hall at lunch all week. Cash and Credit Card are accepted.

We are very happy to announce the re-launch of ExamSource, a free question bank platform for students studying the medical sciences. It is based on the crowd-sourcing concept: Questions are submitted by registered users (free to join!) and must be peer-reviewed before entering active circulation. Questions can be flagged, thus re-entering the peer-review pool. Users are able to bookmark questions for later access and review from their account page. Performance statistics are available on the population level as well as for the individual user to identify weak subjects. The question bank has been designed with mobile computing in mind, users are able to sign in from any computer or handheld, web-enabled device to practice for that upcoming exam.

We are able to offer an educational elective during MS4 for students to write questions for ExamSource. This is a very interview-schedule friendly rotation.

Find out more below!

Hi everyone! The first lunchtime lecture sponsored by OSM is tomorrow at 12pm in Mazurek 305.  Dr. Walters (Emergency Physician at Beaumont) will be presenting on Civil War Medicine.  Lunch will be provided, and we'd love for you to join us!

At the Association of American Medical Colleges (AAMC) conference in November 2012, My Health Report (MHR) was once again put on display and met with great enthusiasm from schools across the Country. As a student-drive patient initiative, MHR sparked the AAMC with ideas on how to improve health screening and patient education. In addition, schools across the country now have full-access to our free product. Stay tuned for more on MHR as we move to a national patient education model!
Peter translated My Health Report into Chinese, and it's being used at the first APAMSA health fair of the year.
Held by the Temple of I AM and Henry Ford Hospital.
Come out TONIGHT to Old Shillelaghs to meet the new M1s! The DJ is upstairs on the roof and there's live music downstairs. The $5 cover can be paid in cash or credit.
Come out and meet the class of 2016 tomorrow night! RSVP here: http://www.facebook.com/events/467429889934677/
We're having a pre-orientation party for the incoming M1s. Come out to catch up with your classmates and meet the new M1s!

Visit our website to see the article!
http://osmso.org/enea-gjoka-featured-in-crains-detroit-business/

http://osmso.org/chris-collins-rheumpearls/

Congratulations to Michael Ostach on becoming the Research Coordinator for a pilot clinical trial this summer looking at the elderly population in metro-Detroit! Are you in Detroit June 15th-July 15th? Ask us how to get involved in research!
Eyes bleeding from studying? Join OSM member Brian Haber in a almost-end-of-the-year dance!

Lecture Halls without Lectures — A Proposal for Medical Education: An interesting perspective on medical education reform is offered this week in the New England Journal of Medicine by Charles G. Prober, M.D., and Chip Heath, Ph.D. Excerpt is below, please see the NEJM website for full text.

"The last substantive reform in medical student education followed the Flexner Report, which was written in 1910. In the ensuing 100 years, the volume of medical knowledge has exploded, the complexity of the health care system has grown, pedagogical methods have evolved, and unprecedented opportunities for technological support of learners have become available. Yet students are being taught roughly the same way they were taught when the Wright brothers were tinkering at Kitty Hawk.

It’s time to change the way we educate doctors. Since the hours available in a day have not increased to accommodate the expanded medical canon, we . . ."

Read full at: http://www.nejm.org.proxy.lib.wayne.edu/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMp1202451

Wir brauchen Eure Mithilfe! Bitte teilen!
Am gestrigen Dienstag, den 28.04.2015 wurde in der Zeit zwischen 13:30 und 14:10 eines unserer Firmenfahrzeuge in Seeg i. Allgäu auf dem Parkplatz vor dem Rathaus angefahren und beschädigt.
Leider hielt es der Verursacher nicht für nötig, diesen Schaden zu melden!
Für Hinweise, die zur Feststellung des Verursachers führen, setzen wir eine Belohnung von 150,- EUR aus!
Als Partner von Fujitsu und Univention GmbH freuen wir uns natürlich sehr darüber!
Unser Geschäftsführer Siegfried Liebig freut sich, künftig bei der Ausbildung neuer Fachinformatiker entscheidend mitwirken zu dürfen.

posts.message: http://www.pro-linux.de/news/1/21390/linux-migration-der-stadtverwaltung-gummersbach-abgeschlossen.html

Heute ist Tag der Systemadministratoren! Zur Feier des Tages ein kleiner Artikel:
http://www.heise.de/netze/meldung/SysAdmin-Day-Von-der-Verantwortung-eines-Admins-Teil-II-2265343.html

Das überrascht uns nun doch etwas...

Bevor allerdings Oberbürgermeister Reiter behauptet Open-Source-Software hinke Microsoft hinterher, sollte er sich vorab schlau machen, was Open-Source-Software überhaupt ist, und wo sie überall als Vorreiter eingesetzt wird bzw. nicht mehr weg zu denken ist. Auch das mit dem "externen Mailserver" sollte Herr Schmid nochmal genauer erklären. :-)
Leider ist im geschäftskritischen und sicherheitsrelevanten Umfeld nicht alles so einfach wie Daheim. Es reicht eben nicht aus, das Smartphone mit Facebook, Google, iCloud und Co. zu verbinden uns alles ist gut.
Zudem klingen die beschriebenen Probleme nicht etwa nach Fehlern in Software, sondern eher nach Fehlern in Organisation, etc.
Für eine Wartezeit von 4 Wochen auf ein Smartphone kann man Open-Source-Software nun beim besten Willen nicht verantwortlich machen. Technisch gesehen lassen sich alle Anforderungen mindestens genauso gut durch Open-Source-Software lösen. Ob es in München tatsächlich verschiedene Programme zur Verwaltung von E-Mails, Terminen und Kontakten gibt, ist aus unserer Sicht eher zweifelhaft. Wenn ja, so muss hier dringend etwas getan werden - es gibt Open-Source-Software (Groupware), die diese Anforderung problemlos meistert - wir sprechen hier aus Erfahrung im Umfeld der öffentlichen Verwaltung. Andernfalls zeugt eine derartige Aussage von immenser Unkenntnis.

Wir sind gespannt, ob sich München, wie Freiburg, zurück in den Vendor-Lockin begibt, oder ob es sich seine hart erkämpfte Freiheit bewahrt. Als moderne und "offene" Stadt gibt es eigentlich nur einen Weg :-)

OpenZ 3.0 veröffentlicht! OpenZ revolutioniert Customizing von Geschäftsprozessen.

OpenZ 3.0 ermöglicht jetzt die Abbildung und Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen in Echtzeit - „on the fly“. Entsprechende Änderungen von Funktionen im ERP-System werden während der Laufzeit errechnet und stehen unmittelbar zur Verfügung. Ein Browser-Refresh reicht. Damit können Key User leicht eigene Geschäftsprozesse definieren. Für die Unternehmen bedeutet dies erhebliche Kostenreduktion bei der Entwicklung und Anpassung ihrer ERP-Systeme.

http://www.openz.de/

posts.message:
Ever since i posted on my wall about the Google Cardboard purchase that i made, Ive been flooded with questions on what it is... So i decided to make things clear and also dust out this page that has been collecting cyber webs! 
Anyway... Google Cardboard is an idea by google to bring virtual reality to everyone. So you ask what is virtual reality? Ill explain.
You see virtual reality or VR creates a virtual image of something and immerses us into it... Imagine that you are at home and would like to walk around in Paris, well with the cardboard it is now possible with the help of google street view and anhigh speed data connection(not completely though). Before getting to that ill tell what all goes into making a google cardboard.
As the name suggests it is completely made of cardboard and can be assembled at home following these steps.
 https://www.google.com/get/cardboard/downloads/wwgc_manufacturers_kit_v1.2.zip
If you are like me and lazy to assemble yourself go to ebay or amazon and order an assembled one. The things that go into it are
1. Cardboard
2. 2 convex lenses
3. neodymium magnets
and you have yourself a google cardboard
Now how it works...
like the picture shows place the phone in the flap after launching VR apps of your liking, close the flap and now place thee cardboard to your face and you are in the Virtual World of your liking... You can choose from a ton of apps on playstore, app store or windows store. the only thing is your phone should be Android 4.1+ or iOS 5/6+ and the phone should have a gyroscope. Once the app is open and placed in... it displays the same image on both sides like in the picture. after putting on the headset you can look in a 360 degree view and feel like you are at that place. The 2 images merges into one due to some physics shit that has to do something with lenses in the cardboard.
the apps i use can be seen in the pictures below but the merged image formation could not be photographed... 
Now the issues i face. The materials aint of high quality, the lenses arent the best and a lot of light sweeps through... the only way is to use it at night. but what can one expect from a Rs360($6) thing? the next is this requires both CPU and GPU power, So there is high battery drain and heat output. but since i use a custom kernel i can switch between thermal throttling, economy mode and other options which means battery drain and heat can be reduced to an extent. this is not applicable for all the devices out there. Anyway this is all there is that i can think about. any questions can be left in the comments...

Airtel has finally showed its bad side!!! I used to have Airtel to which I changed after using Vodafone just to have an experience... And I've got to say it sucks!!! Airtel offers 2GB unlimited 2G data at ₹201 for 28days... They claim speeds that I never got!!! To put things into perspective... When I was on Vodafone I got 2GB unlimited 2G data at ₹199 for 30days and when in the 2GB range there was comparatively higher speeds!!! But after 2GB the unlimited bit of data had a speed similar to that of airtel before their 2GB data is over!!! So do I need to talk about how slow airtel was after the 2GB?! I got so fed up with data, calls and SMS that I switched to BSNL... Yes there are moments with BSNL when I feel like throwing my phone down... But its temporary... I get speeds up to 4Mbps at nights and 1Mbps in the morning if I have good signal strength...
Anyway VoIP is a main thing in most Indians life... Talking to children abroad... Business meeting and stuff are all done through smart phones at times... But now airtel is charging its users for VoIP, something no other carrier in the world does!!! So I beg you to stay away from airtel!!!
For all of you in countries where Google Play Music is available (India excluded) you can now download Frozen OST for free!!!
⛄🎄🎅Merry Christmas People!!!🎅🎄⛄

Sony Xperia Z Ultra the high end flagship of Sony that was sort of released less than a year ago is now available in India for ₹18499... 
It has a 6.4" Full HD Display with Triluminous and Bravia Engine... A Snapdragon 800 clocked at 2.3GHz and 2 gigs of RAM... The camera is of 8MP but has no Flash... That is what I find the only draw back of the device... It is seriously thin and light also... I've used the device personally and can vouch for how awesome it is... Did I mention it is also waterproof...

Heads up people... 
Whatever branded glass be it that adorns your screen... Be it any of the 4 Generations of Corning Gorilla Glass or Asahi Dragontrail... If you don't have a screen protector you are in for trouble!!!
These are marketed as Scratch Resistant and tough enough to be shock(read drops) resistant... But u should notice the fact that it is Resistant and not proof... Which means that it can be scratched!!! But requires more force than normal...
There are times in life you are stupid enough to challenge a friend to try scratch the display... And he takes his full might to complete the challenge... Well I learned my lesson... These are resistant to small pressure scratches like maybe keys and coins in the same pocket and not to same things with high pressure... Also these glasses will scratch easily with sand... No need of pressure... The glass will scratch when there is something with a higher hardness involved...
The best solution is using a screen protector!!!
There are 2 types... One is plastic and the other is glass... 
Plastic is actually a this piece of plastic cut in the dimension of your device and applied due to static between the screen and the protector...
The glass one is actually tempered glass sheet specially treated to prevent scratches and display the same properties as the screen... The only extra feature is that it will prevent screen cracks to an extant by shattering itself and spreading the shock... Plastic one only prevents scratches... No shock protection...
Get a screen guard people!!!
Note Edge is launched in India!!! At a price of ₹64,900!!! Getting it anyone?
If you have a Note 2 you are in for a surprise!!! Android lollipop is coming to u!!!
If you thought the current Moto X with its 16GB of memory was too small... Here's a 32GB one for you... Head over to flipkart...

If you have a Moto G(2013/2014) you can now have Android Lollipop 5.0.1 on it... It will take some time to get it on your device since its rolled out in batches to prevent any fault with the update destroying your phone...

I went to a shop yesterday to help my friend pick out a phone and they had an LG G Flex for demo purposes... It is a 6" device that curves from top to bottom in the shape of your face... It has a self healing back panel and a flexible screen... As in it can be made flat by applying pressure on it... Well the funny thing a person came by and tried the phone... He kept it in between 2 raised things and applied force... Now the screen has been damaged as in the images that the screen was showing during the time of pressure application is now imprinted on the glass of the digitiser... 
Now the moral of this story is... Manufacturers may say a device is capable of a lot of things like water proof, dust proof, impact proof etc... But there are always a catch... Like its only waterproof for a depth of so and so for a said time and stuff... So its your responsibility to take care of your device rather than trusting what the manufacturer says... They won't honour your warranty in case of water damage even if your device is waterproof... 
Take Care!!!

It seems like its the season of bans... First Xiaomi and now One Plus... The One Plus was a joint venture by OPPO and Cyanogen Inc. To make a dirt cheap device with specs of a flagship... But now Cyanogen has partnered with Micromax Mobile to bring Cyanogen based devices to India... But after this partnership was announced One Plus decided to launch their One here... Which runs on CM11S... As it infringes the partnership agreement between MMX and Cyanogen, MMX sued 1+ to stop the import of their devices... Which has been granted by the courts... Also it has been announced by Cyanogen that the 1+1 won't be receiving future updates from them...
Xiaomi has been removed from ban... Now the devices with Mediatek processors cannot be sold... That means the Snapdragon powered Mi3 and Redmi 1S can be sold here...

Hey guys... I'm sorry for the inactivity... I was busy with my personal things and couldn't spare time... 
If anyone is interested to write here let me know... Based on your technical know how you'll be made my editor...☺
Microsoft has launched the Lumia 535 in India for ₹9200!!!
If you are a Sony M2 or an M2 dual owner... Brace yourself... 4.4.4 is gonna hit you soon... Go to setting and check for updates...
Moto 360 the "Smartwatch of the Year" as some people call it is now available to be purchased in India at a price tag of ₹17999... It runs on the android wear platform... Anyone getting it?!?

It seems OnePlus is readying a successor for the One... Well this is going to be tough for the consumers... People are now receiving invites for the OnePlus One(I received one yesterday for what I registered before its release) and more people are still waiting... And with this announcement people will prefer buying the latest and greatest instead of the old device... So either there will be a huge stock and no demand or people might buy the current gen as probably everyone who registers for an invite would probably receive it by the next device launch... So people of India planning on getting one when it releases or those who live outside India think twice before investing on the current generation and also on waiting for the next One...

If you know what the One Plus One is... You probably wanted one... Till now they only shipped to international markets via an invitation system... It seems they are gonna launch it in India on the 2nd of December the same way as they did with the international markets... Via invitation system... And they have partned with amazon India... So... Are you getting one?!?
One Plus One Indian launch imminent as Amazon India has posted a teaser and a contest for sending out invites!!! Anyone interested?!?

iOS users... If you have been facing bugs its not you its Apple!!! They have issued the 8.1.1 bug fix updates with more bugs... Now you can see why iOS is the least unstable OS around...
It seems the relatively new Moto 360 is getting a refresh!!! And is set to be launched early next year... You might want to hold off buying the current gen if this is the case...

It seems encryption by default in Lollipop is hampering the write and performance speeds of the Nexus 6 & 9!!! And there seems to be no fix at the moment... But don't worry... Its android some developer out there is hard at work to fix this!!!
Here's a look at the Lollipop update that's gonna hit HTC devices soon... It won't exactly be the same but removing something's such as the on-screen nav bar  the ui will mostly be the same!!!

George Katodrytis gave a presentation in Dubai on Tuesday 4 November 2014 titled ‘The physicality of displacement: a place of impossible space - Refugee Camps’. The presentation addressed spatial issues of forced migration and refugee camps in the Middle East. The physicality of displacement is characterized  by continuous material transformation. The contemporary camp mimics the city but remains a space of exception. In effect the history of the camp is associated with the struggle of the refugee to come in terms with the symbolic value of the camp. Refugees always live in a state of rejection in terms of repatriation, local integration and resettlement.  They are ‘un-representable’ and are immune from local jurisdictions. In effect the camp turns into a self-regulatory state, a ‘remote-control’ existence and convoluted space-power system with multiple interests and hierarchies. We seem to be incapable to make any contribution either because of negation but mainly of willful ignorance. We are prepared to look the other way. Maybe we can make an impact both conceptually and practically at various spatial scales and infrastructure and connect some of the lines and thresholds of these broken parts.
Fig.1- Camp 1 - 100,000 refugees, aerial photo, 2014
Fig.2 - Camp 2a - 45,000 refugees, Google Earth, 2014
Fig. 3 - Camp 2b - 45,000 refugees, passage, 2014
Fig.4 - Camp 3 - 100,000 refugees, approach, 2014
Refugee Camps Research | 100,000 refugees emergency camp, aerial photo, 2014. #refugee #camp #aerialphoto #research #camps #campcity

posts.message: Videos of FSOSS 2015 are now available on the CDOT Seneca YouTube channel. Click below for the full playlist and thank you to everyone for attending.
early bird registration ends Oct. 16.  Register now at http://fsoss.ca

We are pleased to announce that FSOSS 2015 will be celebrating 30 Years of Freedom on October 29-30. Join us as we celebrate the 30th birthday of the Free Software Foundation and examine the future of free software and open source. Keynote speakers include:

        Mark Surman, Executive Director, Mozilla Foundation
        Ruth Suehle, Community Marketing Manager, Red Hat

Register today,  at http://fsoss.ca
Submit a presentation proposal at http://fsoss.senecac.on.ca/2015/presentation-proposal-form
and
Please help us get the word out - forward this message to like minded friends and colleagues.
FSOSS 2015 is happening this October 29-30! Mark Surman, the executive director of the Mozilla Foundation, is the first keynote speaker who will be taking part. Mark your calendars.
Our schedule is up! If you haven't registered yet, you have until this Sunday, October 19th to do so online.

David Humphrey (CDOT Researcher for Mozilla Foundation)

FSOSS 2014 Early Bird Pricing Extended!
If you have not signed up yet, you still have until Oct. 10 to do so for our early bird rate. You can register or find more info here:

http://fsoss.ca
Just a friendly reminder that Early Bird Registration ends next Friday, Sept. 26! Check out the list of speakers we've got so far.
Early Bird Registration open and ends on September 26, 2014. General $40, Student/ Staff (from ANY institution) $20. Get your tickets now to save.

The theme of FSOSS 2014 is "I am Open Source", and we welcome presentation proposals at fsoss.ca/2014/presentation-proposal-form . We want presentations from all kinds of open source enthusiasts - users and contributors, volunteers and entrepreneurs. Talks can be directed at any level of expertise.

Please submit your proposals soon - the first round of submissions closes July 31st.
Keep an eye on fsoss.ca for further announcements.
We are excited to announce two featured keynote speakers: Bob Young (Red Hat, Inc. co-founder) and Chris Aniszczyk (Twitter's Open Source Engineering Manager).
Reminder that Early Bird Pricing ends Thursday, October 11! Help us spread the word and share this event with any interested friends you might have.
We are now accepting Presentation Proposals for FSOSS 2012! Friday, October 26 is the main event date.
If you haven't registered yet, make sure to do it before this Friday, October 8th. Early bird pricing is in effect: $20 for students, $40 general attendees. http://fsoss.ca/

La nuova sede di Puglia SOS: un primo passo
In gennaio Puglia Software Open Source aprirà una sede operativa nel centro storico di Barletta.

Joomla , uno dei più popolari sistemi di content management open source del mondo (CMS), ha annunciato oggi il lancio del suo nuovo servizio: Joomla.com . Gli utenti possono ora creare e costruire siti web Joomla liberamente ospitati. Il progetto è gestito in partnership con SiteGround società di web hosting, che ha costruito l'infrastruttura server che ospiterà i siti gratuiti Joomla.

Sono tante le informazioni provenienti dai vari team di Joomla!, per cui può essere difficile rimanere aggiornati su tutte le novità: Joomla Magazine Team e Joomla Extension Directory stanno lavorando insieme per condividere più informazioni.

Appuntamento a mercoledì 15 aprile alle 16,30 per il secondo incontro del corso GRATUITO di INFORMATICA di base: un corso pomeridiano per imparare ad usare il computer partendo da zero. 
E' possibile inserirsi, recuperando i contenuti già affrontati, con l'aiuto delle signore dell'Age - Associazione Genitori - di Barletta.
Prenotazioni e info al 3209562552 - segreteria@pugliasos.it

Appuntamento a domani 13 aprile alle 16,30 per l'inizio del corso GRATUITO di INFORMATICA di base: un corso pomeridiano per imparare ad usare il computer partendo da zero. 
Prenotazioni e info al 3209562552 - segreteria@pugliasos.it

La Scuola Media "Renato Moro" di Barletta, l'Associazione Genitori sez. di Barletta e Puglia Software Open Source, organizzano il corso di informatica di base "SOS Comunicazione: un aiuto per i genitori".
Il corso rivolto agli adulti, che avrà inizio il 13 aprile e si svilupperà in otto incontri pomeridiani, di lunedì e mercoledì dalle ore 16.30 alle 19.00, partendo dalle più elementari nozioni di informatica affronterà con attività laboratoriali le nuove opportunità di comunicazione e socializzazione quali: Internet, Facebook, Skype, Hello, Hangouts, email, programmi di scrittura, ...
La partecipazione è gratuita; i posti sono limitati per cui è obbligatoria l'iscrizione.
Per informazioni ed iscrizioni:
cell. 320 956 2552
e-mail: segreteria@pugliasos.it

Anche quest'anno non poteva mancare il corso "SOS COMUNICAZIONE: un aiuto per i genitori" giunto alla sua quinta edizione.
Organizzato con L'AGe - Associazione Genitori - sezione di Barletta e la Scuola Media "Renato Moro" avrà fra i temi i nuovi strumenti di socializzazione attraverso Internet.
Info: 320 956 2552

SIGE – Simple Image Gallery Extended – è un plugin di tipo content che permette la visualizzazione di una galleria di immagini in un articolo di Joomla!. Se lo accompagniamo con il plugin SIGE - Simple Image Gallery Extended - Editor Button inseriamo nell'editor il pulsante SIGE Parameters che ci consente di configurare "al volo", e facilmente, i parametri per SIGE.
Per saperne di più leggi l'articolo di Giuseppe Isernia pubblicato sul sito italiano di Joomla! (joomla.it)

L'Open Source è un modello di sviluppo basato sulla condivisione e l'innovazione. Joomla è basato su questa filosofia; questa è una delle ragioni del suo successo.
Vi sono 6 motivi che fanno di Joomla!  il miglior software per creare siti web.

1 - Joomla! è uno dei tre CMS gratuiti più diffusi.

2 - Una volta installato Joomla! il tuo sito sarà pronto per il SEO, moduli di contatto, RSS, blog, media, multi lingua, etc.
Un utente esperto è in grado di fare l'installazione in 1 minuto e 45 minuti per pubblicare i contenuti: un semplice sito può essere pronto in meno di 1 ora.

3 - Vuoi costruire un  sito web con caratteristiche non  incluse nell'installazione predefinita?
Fai una rapida ricerca in Joomla Extensions Directory (la JED, la directory delle estensioni): vi è di tutto per soddisfare le tue esigenze.

4 - Joomla è sostenuta da numerosi volontari che  creano software da condividere con il mondo.
Il potere di una comunità si basa sulle persone che lo sostengono.

5 - Joomla è internazionale.
È possibile creare siti web non solo in inglese, ma anche in italiano, cinese, portoghese, spagnolo, ebraico, catalano, francese... in un considerevole numero di lingue.

6 - Joomla è ben codificato ed ha una flessibilità sicura (override).
L'estensioni sostanzialmente sono addons per estendere le funzionalità di Joomla! e sono di tre tipi:
• Componenti, per creare e gestire il contenuto di una pagina.
• Moduli, per creare e gestire blocchi di contenuti con determinate e particolari caratteristiche.
• Plugin, per aggiungere nuove funzionalità ai componenti e moduli.

Creare un sito web non è stato mai così facile!!

Facebook changed something again & failed to let us know. Look at your URL address (the top box on your screen.) If you see "http" instead of "https" you DO NOT have a secure session & can be HACKED. Go to Account - Account Settings - Account Security - click Change. Check box (secure browsing), click Save. FB has automatically set it on the non-secure setting! Do your friends a huge favor, copy & re-post!!!!

AGILE ERP SOLUTIONS LTD. is one of the leading Information Technology Solution Companies in Bangladesh with a strong talented team that provides extensive range of products and services. It has built a reputation for innovation and delivering excellence in enterprise application development, with industry-specific software expertise in financial, real estate and medical sectors. We offer comprehensive products and services, custom software and web solutions for businesses worldwide. With a rich experience of successful offshore & national engagements, we are committed to building long lasting strategic partnerships with our clients to ensure extremely competitive and affordable prices, timely delivery and measurable business results. We constantly focus on providing high quality products and services to meet the exacting requirements of our customers.

AGILE ERP SOLUTIONS LTD. is one of the leading Information Technology Solution Companies in Bangladesh with a strong talented team that provides extensive range of products and services. It has built a reputation for innovation and delivering excellence in enterprise application development, with industry-specific software expertise in financial, real estate and medical sectors. We offer comprehensive products and services, custom software and web solutions for businesses worldwide. With a rich experience of successful offshore & national engagements, we are committed to building long lasting strategic partnerships with our clients to ensure extremely competitive and affordable prices, timely delivery and measurable business results. We constantly focus on providing high quality products and services to meet the exacting requirements of our customers.

Our Motto: Save environment sustainably through promoting paperless office.
We have a great pleasure to inform you that we, some of business graduates who are certified from Bangladesh Computer Council (BCC), Ministry of information Technology, Government of Bangladesh on ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) Implementation, are working on Environmental sustainability as well as improving organizational efficiency and effectiveness through building paperless office system by using Open Source Enterprise Software like Odoo ERP . 
As you know, ERP is an integrated business software package to collect, store, manipulate and retrieve data from different business functions. As business activities grow day by day, business functions are become decentralized. So it will be quite impossible for any bossiness people to compete with others in the near future without a centralized business system to retrieve data and interpret data to information. Moreover ERP will be the ultimate source of Competitiveness for any business.    
We are offering extremely low cost and highly efficient ERP implementation for your reputed organization. 
Our ERP implementation have five steps – 1) Installation, 2) Configuration,3) Customization, 4) Data Conversion & 5) Integration.
Our software is open source web based (Oddo 8) & free of cost, anyone can download from the following link-https://nightly.odoo.com/8.0/nightly/exe/
And to get crystal clear idea about the software you can visit this site - https://www.odoo.com/
Initially, you required only one desktop PC or Laptop for dedicated ERP Implementation and need to hire one personnel from us who will act as a key person for ERP implementation project.
We will provide more than 20 people to you for taking interview regarding business process and technical knowledge, from that you will select your best option.
That person is very much efficient on three major part of ERP Implementation like – 1) Installation, 2) Configuration, and 3) Data Conversion & user training.  In most of the cases these three steps are good enough to go on ERP live project. Other two steps - 1) Customization & 2) Integration are not required.
If you required other two steps - 1) Customization & 2) Integration, we have expert team members, they will support for these free of cost.
If you have patience & time, then give us the opportunity to meet with you for presenting our business plan at your premises, then we can able to know each other and explain your every question in detail. If your organizations are interested then you can also e-mail us for detailed proposal.
For more information about us, you can also visit facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/erpinbd/ facebook group:https://www.facebook.com/groups/1489187234717040/
And our youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvZeekOET1evzLbLgKehp0A
If you have any query regarding the same, please feel free to contact with us.
Email:erpinbd@outlook.com Skype: erpinbd Mobile:+8801515653940
http://epaper.prothom-alo.com/home/singleArticle/2015_11_18_17_17_b#.Vkwci0GjaEI.facebook

انطلاقا من خبرتنا في سوق العمل المحلي والخارجي في مجال تطوير البرمجيات للهواتف الذكيّة ، الويب ، التدريس والتدريب ، عملت مجموعة مطوري جوجل في جامعة البترا خلال الاشهر الماضية على تطوير برنامج تدريبي متكامل. ويشمل هذا البرنامج دورات الآندرويد للمستوى المبتدأ والمتقدم حيث يتم تقديم شرح تفصيلي لكثير من المواضيع المتعلقة بلغة الجافا و الآندرويد وتصميم البرمجيات.

الهدف من هذا البرنامج هو تأهيل الطالب بشكل متكامل لعمل تطبيقات ناجحة ومتكاملة، حيث يتم الاشراف على عمل هذه التطبيقات من قبل عامر عبيده صاحب شركة بينسيلو . كما نضمن لكم الخروج من هذا البرنامج مؤهلين الى سوق العمل حيث يحصل المتدرب على شهادة خبرة لمدة 60 ساعة تدريبيه (تعتبر تدريب ميداني لطلاب الجامعات) من شركة بينسلو وجامعة البترا ويتم تدريبه على كيفية عمل المقابلات.كما تشمل الدورةعلى الكثير من المواضيع الأخرى التي تساعد المبرمج على تصميم البرامج بشكل عام مثل: N-tier Architecture، UX and Usability، Software Design Patterns و تعتبر هذه المواضيع من الأساسيات في عمل جميع البرامج وليس فقط تطبيقات الهواتف الذكية.

وفي نهاية 60 ساعة التدريبيه ستقوم بالعمل على اتمام مشروعك داخل مجموعة مطوري جوجل ليتم الارتقاء به ليكون مشروع تخرج او ليتم رفعه على سوق اندرويد.

تقسم الدورة الى :
-	10 ساعة تأسيسية لتعلم ما يلزمك من لغة الجافا (كم يتم تعلم مفاهيم جديدة خلال شرح المواضيع المتعلقة بالآندرويد)
-	40 ساعة لتعلم المواضيع المتعلقة بالآندرويد
-	10 ساعة لعمل تطبيق متكامل تحت اشراف الاستاذ عامر عبيده 

ويتم استكمال المشروع كما ذكر سابقا داخل المجموعة .

سعر الدوره هوه سعر مخفض .
مكان الدوره هوه جامعة البترا .
وقت الدوره مسائي .

للاستفسار الرجاء الاتصال على:
0790350957 عبد الرحمن
0795716139 يوسف

وقع نادي النشاطات الطلابيه مجموعة مطوري جوجل في جامعة البترا اليوم اتفاقيه تعاون مشترك مع شركة Pencilo وذلك من خلال عقد دوره تدريبيه و لمدة 60 ساعة تدريبيه للطلبة .

يذكر ان دورة الاندرويد تمتاز بعدة مزايا ميزتها عن باقي دورات الاندرويد بالخارج من خلال الشهادات و المشاريع .

كما سيتم الاعلان عن تفاصيل الدوره باعلانات في جامعة البترا ,الزيتونه , الشرق الاوسط ,الاسراء و كلية القدس

احجز مقعدك الان من خلال الرابط :
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1V41j1NB0CAGt5k0CqZ5wwRAXdvFvKqagteuFEofvR_U/viewform


للاستفسار او التسجيل الاتصال على :
عبد الرحمن 0790350957
يوسف 0795716139

يا جماعة بدنا نعمل اجتماع ضروري يوم الاثنين الجاي بتاريخ 22\7 من الساعة 1:00 الى الساعة 2:00 بالساك لازم تحضرو كلكم .

1- موضوع الشهادات انا الي فهموني ياه انو ببعتوهم قاعدين فمفروض في ناس منكم وصلهم ولي ما وصله وعد من هون ليوم الاجتماع يكون واصله شهادته 

ياريت كمان اتخبرو الجماعة الي كانو معانا بالاول و تركو عشان ياخدو شهاداتهم , وحتى في ناس من جماعة الثاني مش مسجلين يا ريت يلحقو حالهم 

2- نحن بنجهز حاليا لدورة اندرويد ما صارت بالاردن فيعني لازم تحضرو عشان الموضوع فيه شغل وفيه مصاري الكم انتو كمان .

3- نحن ما وقفنا شغلنا بالعكس نحن كبرنا اكتر و صار في عنا مجالات اوسع و اكبر ف الي حابب يكمل معنا اكيد الباب مفتوحلة لاشياء و مزايا اكتر من اول بكتير هنحكي عنها كلها بالاجتماع تبع يوم الاثنين 

رمضان كريم و كل عام وانتو بخير 3> احلى team :)
